references.reason: This paper introduces the DreamFusion method, a core concept and baseline method used in the current paper’s experiments to generate 3D models from text prompts, making it a highly influential work.
This paper presents Magic3D, another significant baseline method used in the experiments, providing a comparison point for evaluating the proposed method's effectiveness.

references.paper_title: Prolificdreamer: High-fidelity and diverse text-to-3d generation with variational score distillation
references.reason: This paper introduces the ProlificDreamer method, a third core baseline in the experimental evaluation, enabling a comprehensive analysis of the proposed method across multiple state-of-the-art baselines.

references.paper_title: Nerf: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces NeRF, a fundamental 3D representation technique used by several of the baseline methods, underscoring its importance in the field of text-to-3D generation.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational 2D diffusion model used to guide the generation of 3D models in the SDS-based methods, demonstrating its crucial role as the underlying technology for the text-to-3D pipeline.
